relations.target: column=03077981-n ((architecture) a tall vertical cylindrical structure standing upright and used to support a structure);03078384-n (a vertical cylindrical structure standing alone and not supporting anything (such as a monument));03078578-n (a vertical glass tube used in column chromatography; a mixture is poured in the top and washed through a stationary substance where components of the mixture are adsorbed selectively to form colored bands);05593649-n (any tubular or pillar-like supporting structure in the body);06279010-n (a page or text that is vertically divided; \""the newspaper devoted several columns to the subject\""; \""the bookkeeper used pages that were divided into columns\"");06279220-n (an article giving opinions or perspectives);08446009-n (a line of units following one after another);08450585-n (a vertical array of numbers or other information; \""he added a column of numbers\"");13923115-n (anything that approximates the shape of a column or tower; \""the test tube held a column of white powder\""; \""a tower of dust rose above the horizon\""; \""a thin pillar of smoke betrayed their campsite\""

pillar=03077981-n ((architecture) a tall vertical cylindrical structure standing upright and used to support a structure);03078384-n (a vertical cylindrical structure standing alone and not supporting anything (such as a monument));05922436-n (a fundamental principle or practice; \""science eroded the pillars of superstition\"");10452721-n (a prominent supporter; \""he is a pillar of the community\"");13923115-n (anything that approximates the shape of a column or tower; \""the test tube held a column of white powder\""; \""a tower of dust rose above the horizon\""; \""a thin pillar of smoke betrayed their campsite\""
